column2: CEEW is looking for qualified individuals passionate about circular economy and potential green jobs opportunities brought by sectors emerging from circular economy, particularly post-consumer waste management      The aim of the project is to assess current and potential job opportunities in different phases of management of identified waste streams in Odisha and skill requirements of such opportunities, through research, stakeholder consultations and site visits      The project will require both qualitative and quantitative research, analysis and reporting the findings      In addition, the project will involve effective collaboration and meetings with industry, government, and civil society stakeholders at the state and sub-state levels      CEEW provides an intellectually stimulating and supportive work environment that emphasises research rigour, innovative thinking, and strategic outreach      We are seeking a meticulous and motivated individual who contributes to the dynamic research environment at CEEW and is passionate about translating research into action      We recommend that the applicants visit the Circular Economy team page on the CEEW website for more details about our projects          Primary Responsibilities          Research and analysis          Research: The research intern will be responsible for conducting thorough research into post-consumer waste management operations and its different phases      This will involve reviewing existing literature, and gathering data to gain a deeper understanding of the currents jobs and skills associated with each phase      The research will also include reviewing methodologies used for assessment of jobs particularly in the waste sector, correlating it with Indian context and its validation with stakeholders          Data collection and stakeholder consultation:          The research intern will be responsible to identify relevant stakeholders across value chain of different waste streams including but not limited to Odisha      In addition, prepare questionnaires, carry out interviews and field visits to gather data on waste generation, its management in different phases and jobs created due to its management          Analysing data:          The research intern will be responsible for organising and analysing data gathered to develop an estimate of number of jobs creation, existing and potential, due to circular economy sectors      This will involve using statistical and technical softwares (like python, SAM, excel etc) and other tools to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data          Other responsibilities          Collaborating with other teams:          The research intern will need to work closely with other researchers, agencies and entities engaged in waste management industry, civil society organisations and state officials      Collaboration will be essential to validate the research and verify the methodology used to assess the potential job creation and ensure that the research is relevant and valuable to those who will be implementing waste management operations          Strategic communications:          The research intern must communicate their findings to various audiences, including industry and state stakeholders, researchers, policymakers, and the public      This will involve writing articles for academic journals, presenting at conferences, or creating educational materials for the public, with the help of CEEW's outreach team          Identifying new research opportunities:          The research intern will be responsible for identifying new research opportunities in the field of circular economy      This will involve keeping up-to-date with the latest developments in solar photovoltaic waste and battery waste recycling, among others, and identifying areas where further research is needed to advance the field          Qualification          Masters degree in environmental engineering, environmental management or planning, urban planning, urban sanitation, waste management, or related field      Graduate candidates in these fields with proven track record may also be considered      Candidates pursuing their Masters can apply          Key skills          Strong ability to identify and manage stakeholders and carry out consultations      Strong ability to organise, process, and analyse large data sets that are used and derived through stakeholder consultation, secondary research and software tools      Excellent written and oral communication skills      Ability to summarise and communicate the insights/findings as reports and presentations      Strong technical expertise and interpersonal skills      Proficiency in MS Excel and understanding of programming languages like Python and other software for performing quantitative analysis/simulations      Proficiency in Hindi and English is a must; proficiency in Oriya is desirable          Personality          Willingness to work on multi-disciplinary projects      Willingness to learn new research and project management skills      Ability to identify creative solutions to vexing challenges in taking policy to action      Ability to adapt and deliver under tight deadlines in a professional environment      Ability to effectively work in a team while being able to independently drive the work with minimum assistance      Ability and willingness to dig deeper into details, while also keeping a sense of the broader objectives and big picture      Willingness to learn, grow and develop at a personal and professional front, at a rapid pace with a steep learning curve      Ability to work in an interdisciplinary and multicultural environment
column11: Waste management, SAN, Research Intern, Quantitative research, Data collection, Secondary research, CRM, Python

column2: The Research and Development Scientist is responsible for managing and completing R&D projects, both alone and in collaboration with other R&D personnel, often as a member of a global team.                                        ?       Job Responsibilities                  The Research and Development Scientist is responsible for managing and completing R&D projects, both alone and in collaboration with other R&D personnel, often as a member of a global team.                  Project work will be the focus, with application development based on Customer requirement, raw material qualification expected to occupy some proportion of the work.                  Track patent and Scientific literature.                  Follow stage-gate project management system and document project progress.                  The Scientist will have responsibilities, like support ISO audit program, monitor and follow health and lab safety and take-up additional responsibilities, as when requirement comes up.                  The mission of the Scientist is to develop new products as dictated by business needs, conducting sophisticated chemical research quickly, cost effectively, and safely. The position will be located in Bangalore, India at the Cookson India Research Centre, and will report to the R&D Manager at the site.                      Requirements & Qualifications                  Ph.D. in Chemistry; Inorganic/Polymer Chemistry with Electrochemistry background is strongly preferred.                  2-3 years of Industrial R&D or Post-doctoral research experience in Surface finishing, Polymer based coatings etc, preferred.                  An advanced understanding of the surface finishing industry that will allow effective collaboration with plating experts on product development projects.                  Proven ability to track, manage, and report on the progress of complex projects, and to consistently meet deadlines.

column2: Role & responsibilities     The  ideal candidate will have a strong background in signal processing algorithms and extensive   experience in programming languages commonly used in DSP applications. Programming:  Implement DSP algorithms using programming languages such as C, C++, MATLAB, or  Python. Integration:  Integrate DSP algorithms into existing software frameworks and hardware platforms. Documentation:  Create comprehensive documentation including design specifications, test plans,  and user guides. Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. column2: Role & responsibilities     Idea Generation Brainstorming : Foster a creative environment to generate ideas with team members and stakeholders. Consumer Insights : Collect feedback through surveys, focus groups, and social listening. Market Research : Identify market trends, analyze competitors, and spot market opportunities.  2.   Idea Screening Evaluate ideas for feasibility, alignment with brand strategy, market potential, and profitability. Select the most viable concepts for further development.  3.  Concept Development Transform promising ideas into detailed product concepts. Specify product features, benefits, target demographics, and market positioning. Outline initial marketing approaches and price estimations. 4. Business Analysis Analyze cost implications, projected revenues, and potential profitability. Evaluate financial viability and estimate the return on investment. 5. Prototype Development Develop and refine product prototypes or samples. Conduct tests to validate functionality, performance, and market acceptance. 6. Market Testing Consumer Testing : Perform product trials with target customers to obtain feedback on user experience and satisfaction. Market Testing : Execute a small-scale launch to test market demand and gather consumer reactions. 7. Marketing Strategy Develop an exhaustive marketing strategy covering branding, packaging, pricing, distribution, and promotional activities. Determine key selling propositions and unique value propositions. 8. Launch Organize the launch schedule and manage logistics. Collaborate with production, supply chain, and retail partners. Kick off marketing campaigns to promote awareness and stimulate initial sales. 9. Post-Launch Evaluation Track sales and customer feedback following the launch. Use insights for ongoing product refinement and future development. Adjust strategies based on market feedback and evolving consumer needs.   Key Considerations: Consumer Focus : Always prioritize the needs and preferences of the target audience to ensure product relevance. Speed to Market : Strive for prompt development and launch processes to leverage market trends. Team Collaboration : Engage with internal teams and external collaborators to pool expertise and resources. Flexibility : Stay adaptable to swiftly incorporate feedback and emerging market trends. Regulatory and Environmental Standards : Adhere to all applicable regulations and strive for sustainable product solutions. Preferred candidate profile     1. Bachelors degree in product design, engineering, industrial design or a related field. 2. 3+ years of experience in product development or a similar role. 3. Strong understanding of product development processes, from ideation to commercialization. 4. Knowledge of manufacturing processes, materials and cost optimization techniques. 5. Familiarity with market research techniques and consumer behavior in the Indian market. 6. Strong business acumen and market awareness, with the ability to translate customer needs into product requirements. 7. Proficiency in product design software and tools. 8. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with attention to detail and a focus on delivering high-quality products. 9. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to prioritise tasks, manage multiple projects and meet deadlines. 10. A creative mindset and a passion for innovation and continuous improvement. 11. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. 12. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  Perks and benefits     As per the Industry Norms. column2: Job Title: Proposal Writer Company Overview: The Foreign Venture Group is a digital transformation company that specializes in assisting Small Medium Enterprises through a range of essential services. We're passionate about leveraging the power of social media to connect with our audience and showcase our brand in the best light. We are seeking a talented and experienced Proposal Writers to join our team and take our online presence to the next level. Job Overview: The Proposal Writer plays a pivotal role in the Business Development team, responsible for crafting compelling and comprehensive proposals to be bid on by the organization. This role involves close collaboration with the technical team to gather and articulate qualifications, ensuring alignment with the company's objectives and client requirements. The Proposal Writer is also actively involved in contract management and interfaces with various stakeholders including buyers, procurement teams, and supply chain professionals to deliver winning proposals. Responsibilities: 1.   Proposal Development: Lead the end-to-end development of proposals, ensuring they are well-structured, compelling, and meet client requirements. Collaborate with the technical team to gather information on qualifications, capabilities, and project specifics. Conduct thorough research to understand client needs, industry trends, and competitor offerings. 2.   Co-ordination with Technical Team: Work closely with technical experts to translate complex technical information into clear, client-focused language. Ensure all technical qualifications and specifications are accurately represented in proposals. 3.   Strategic Procurement: Develop and implement strategic procurement plans aligned with organizational objectives. Assess and mitigate risks associated with complex work packages, ensuring optimal procurement outcomes. Collaborate with internal business partners to understand their needs and objectives. 4.   Market Assessment and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive market assessments through research, report preparation, and spreadsheet analysis. Provide insightful analysis of market trends, supplier capabilities, and industry dynamics. Make data-driven recommendations to enhance the efficiency of procurement processes. 5.   Contract Negotiation and Management: Participate in contract negotiations with suppliers, ensuring favorable terms and conditions. Prepare, issue, and award contracts, adhering to legal and procurement guidelines. Provide ongoing support to internal business partners in contract management activities. 6.   Tender Management: Develop and issue tender documents, including RFQs, RFPs, and RFPQs. Review all tender documents within the procurement team to ensure accuracy and completeness. Oversee and actively participate in the evaluation of tenders in collaboration with internal business partners. 7.   Supplier Relationship Management: Engage in supplier relationship management activities to ensure positive and collaborative partnerships. Regularly update supplier performance files and contribute to the continuous improvement of supplier relationships. 8.   Stakeholder Interaction: Interface with buyers, procurement teams, and supply chain professionals to gather insights and requirements for proposal customization. Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders. 9.   Quality Assurance: Conduct thorough reviews of proposals to ensure accuracy, compliance, and alignment with company standards. Implement feedback and continuous improvement strategies for enhancing proposal quality. Qualification and Skills: Bachelor's degree (business administration or related field) a plus. Proven experience in proposal writing, contract management, and business development. Familiarity with technical concepts and ability to translate them into layman's terms. Strong project management and organizational abilities. Strong communication (written and verbal) Excellent organizational and time management skills Strong interpersonal skills for stakeholder engagement and relationship building. Ability to work independently and as part of a team Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and precision. Strong analytical and research skills. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. How to Apply: If you meet these qualifications and are excited about the opportunity to support a dynamic executive team in a client-oriented environment, we want to hear from you! Please send your resume, along with a cover letter detailing your pertinent experience as a proposal writer to hr@thefvg.com. Application Process: To apply for this position, please fill out the form using the link below, and submit your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and skills. We appreciate all applications; however, only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview. https://forms.gle/LJerE666JQwaRJUKA The Foreign Venture Group is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply. For more details about the company and role, visit Foreign Venture Group.

column1: Research Associate (Planning) - School of Economic Development (SED)
column2: The School of Economic Development is looking for a research associate interested in economic planning and development      The incumbent will be part of an active practice project with the Chennai Metropolitan Development Authority (CMDA), as part of which IIHS will be providing recommendations for economic planning for the Chennai metropolitan region      We require a dynamic and motivated individual who is capable of working to multiple deadlines, and of working in a large interdisciplinary team      The core responsibility of the position will be to conduct policy and plan analysis and literature review in the context of economic planning for the project, to undertake spatial analysis of multiple datasets, to organise and be a part of stakeholder consultations and to carry out stakeholder interviews, to work with the team to arrive at recommendations based on primary and secondary data analysis, and to coordinate with the Client as required      The candidate will also be responsible for coordinating across multiple teams and will work towards production of reports and presentations required as part of the project                              Activities and Tasks        Responsibilities would include, but not be limited to, the following:        Collecting, analysing and synthesising relevant plan and policy documents, historic documents;      Conducting literature review and synthesising;      Carrying out stakeholder interviews and organising stakeholder workshops;      Conducting primary and secondary research for the project;      Collecting inputs from relevant team members/ external stakeholders and synthesising it for various outputs;      Coordinating with the client and with internal team members;      Report writing and making presentations;      Providing support in project management;      Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations and others;      Participating in all activities of Institution-Building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within or outside the country as and when needed.              Structure and Reporting        The research associate will be an External Consultant coordinating with the Senior Consultant - Practice or with any other person designated by the team leader of the CMDA project, and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and external individuals/organizations, and students.                Person Specification        The ideal candidate should have:        A Graduate and Post graduate degree in Urban Planning or related disciplines;      Prior experience of at least 5 years related to Urban Planning, Urban Economy, Economic Development or Labour and Employment studies;      Experience with report writing; basic familiarity with design is preferred;      Familiarity with the Tamil language and Chennai region (preferable);      Ease in working with inter-disciplinary teams, and engaging with external stakeholders.

column1: Dairy Scientist (Ice-Cream & Frozen Desserts Product Development)
column2: Dear Aspirant, Greetings from Heritage Foods Ltd!! We are looking to hire a dynamic and experienced Dairy Scientist ( Manager Level) in the R&D department for Ice Cream & Frozen Desserts at Hyderabad. The Dairy Scientist will be responsible to lead and drive the Ice-Cream & Frozen desserts category projects and develop high quality, competitive, affordable, and innovative products by adopting best product development processes, ingredients and technology. He/she will act as a subject matter expert and perform experiments in the lab, pilot plant, and in full scale manufacturing by developing new or adapting existing methodologies to achieve the department and organization goals. Interested can e-mail CVs to  ravishankar.m@heritagefoods.in / WhatsApp @ 8977939591.  Pre - Requisites for Dairy Scientist  Qualification:   PG or Graduation in Dairy/Food Technology (preference will be given to PG holders) Reporting to :  Head R&D Work Location :   Corporate Office, Heritage Foods Limited Hyderabad Designation:  Manager Level Key Responsibilities: Drive new ice cream innovations, project execution, process development with better ROI. Finalizing/designing specification of raw materials, formulation, process, pack and Quality Assurance regimes to support / enforce these specs agreed technical action standards. Understand application of principles of Food/Dairy science & technology, chemistry, engineering and microbiology at lab, pilot, factory scale to develop novel ice cream products and processes. Understand key consumer and market insights and translating them into product ideas. Conduct studies to establish shelf-life, melt properties and other characteristics of new products. Troubleshoot at factory-scale when required, Prepare Technical transfer documents, train factory/3P personnel. Establish processes developed at lab/pilot-scale in to Heritage factories/3Ps to enable commercial production. Use appropriate measurement techniques (either existing or develop new techniques) to analyse or characterize key attributes of the ingredients, intermediate products and Finished goods. Effective liaison with other R&D functions, factory / 3Ps / Supply chain, marketing and other cross functions for successful completion projects. Transfer technology from lab to plant scale-up trials. Plan& execute experiments based on the project brief with rigor, analysing the information and data and draw scientific conclusions.  Continuously look for / experiment with new ingredients/recipes/technologies to develop products and processes that offer tangible, new benefits to the consumer and business.  Work in the laboratory to carry out on the bench experiments and in pilot plant to develop novel ice cream products per brief within the cost & regulatory framework Process development. Establishing appropriate process for manufacturing different ice cream & Frozen dessert product formats to specification at lab, pilot and factory scale. Optimize processing parameters.  Intervene through formulation/process to enhance quality of products Develop new Ingredients and vendor for sustainability of manufacturing process. Closely work with team to build R&D capability in the identified areas. Drive best practices New specifications writing, project management and technical report writing.

These stakeholders could include some or all of the following: Product Development (PD), Food Safety (FS), Regulatory Affairs (RA), Quality Assurance (QA), Procurement, Supplier Quality Assurance (SQA)          Manage Supplier relationships and serve as point of contact to gather information/data needed to build specifications; complete timely follow-ups to keep the process moving to completion          Collect supplier questionnaire and manage supplier alignment on spec details          For certain Specifications (eg. Foods & Beverages) initiate material testing requests and validate specification quality parameters          Maintain and update existing specs to ensure compliance with standards          Upload all paperwork (re. Supplier Specs) and materials qualifications into the appropriate system (Product Vision / SAP) and track workflow          For Packaging Specifications only: schedule and conduct Individual Component Specification (ICS) reviews, update documents, and manage supplier approval prior to internal review          Ensure all requests are processed, documented, and delivered within defined SLAs (Service Level Agreements)          Assess, respond, and escalate emerging business critical issues to avoid material supply shortages, outages and production delays            Qualifications              Professional work experience (2-5yrs) gained in Food/Beverage or Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) industry          Evidence of leadership skills when engaging with Senior Stakeholders and/or experience leading small teams          Demonstrated ability to teach, train, coach or mentor others in a technical capacity          Preference for experience in technology system conversion / implementation execution preferred          Ability to interpret and assess complex technical information and issues and seek alignment towards workable solutions          Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite          Ability to rapidly learn computer applications/programs & navigate systems          For Formula and Ingredient Specifications: basic understanding of Food Safety, Microbiology and Regulatory Affairs          Collaborative skills and strong interest in working with others across time zones; Ability to build relationships and work closely with both internal and external partners          Good communication skills oral and written (e.g. communication on telephone, external and internal to PepsiCo, managing with other support group functions, etc.)          Ability to manage time effectively across multiple priorities and projects requiring a high degree of organizational and communication skills to ensure requests are delivered in a timely manner          Exceptional data organizational and problem-solving skills with attention to detail and accuracy          Self-motivated & demonstrated ability to take initiative on projects          Fluent in English (HBS)          Fluent in English and Spanish (if located in MBS)          Bachelor s degree in Food Science, Food Engineering, Food Chemistry, Microbiology, Biochemical Engineering or Chemical Engineering or equivalent relevant experience required.          For Packaging-specific roles: Bachelor s degree in Engineering, Packaging-related field or equivalent relevant experience required          Prior experience of working in a global shared services environment and / or specifications management space preferred          Prior experience working in a large global CPG company, with understanding of the CPG performance outputs and measures preferred          Proven track record of identifying and championing new ingredient and packaging spec writing / management initiatives and process improvements
column11: Procurement, SQA, SAP, Microbiology, Packaging, Workflow, Food safety, Spanish, Material testing, Continuous improvement

column2: Project Role : Engineering Services Practitioner Project Role Description : Assist with end-to-end engineering services to develop technical engineering solutions to solve problems and achieve business objectives. Solve engineering problems and achieve business objectives using scientific, socio-economic, technical knowledge and practical experience. Work across structural and stress design, qualification, configuration and technical management.  Must have skills : Aircraft Structural Analysis Good to have skills : NA Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelors or Masters degree in Mechanical or Aerospace or Structural engineering WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? Performs static stress analysis or fatigue and damage tolerance analysis of aircraft structures using a broad range of standard hand, legacy and harmonized methods, responsible for checking various types of aircraft components and assemblies:Door Surround Structures, Side and Lower Shells, Pax and Cargo Floors, Skins, stringers, various clips, fasteners, joints and fittings etc. To support Sizing & Justification phase.What you would do in this role Experience in Sizing and justification of metallic/Composite primary and secondary aircraft structural components. Experience in Door Surround Structures/Side shells/PAX floors. Experience in GFEM/DFEM creation and Validation Knowledge of airframe static stress analysis including analytical calculation methods (HSB/Niu/Bruhn) and finite element-based analysis. Stress analysis of Metallic and Composite Aircraft Structural components using FEM, ISAMI and Hand Calculations. Experience in ISAMI based analysis. Experience in Buckling and Modal Analysis. Experience in engineering tools, (ISAMI, Hypermesh, NASTRAN, PATRAN, MS Office). Basic Knowledge on CATIA and experience in reading assembly drawings Experience in Technical Report writing skills. Who are we looking for? 1 to 4 years of Aerostructure Stress Analysis Experience Location:Bangalore Education:BE/M.Tech in Mechanical, Aerospace, Aeronautical Engineering or relevant subject Ability to work individually. Supporting continuous improvement initiatives to increase team efficiency. Highly preferred primary and secondary structure experience with good knowledge of tools and methods. Hypermesh, Nastran/Patran, ISAMI Having VBA/Python programming is an added advantage.Additional Information: The candidate should have experience in Aircraft Structural Analysis. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in Aerospace Engineering or a related field. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification Bachelors or Masters degree in Mechanical or Aerospace or Structural engineering
column11: isami, patran, hypermesh, structural analysis, stress analysis, fatigue analysis, python, fea, cae, ansys, modal analysis, fe analysis, finite element analysis, catia, report writing, ansys workbench, fem, msc nastran, vba, nastran, abaqus, vibration analysis, hyperview

column2: 1Role & responsibilities   1. Work on real-time control development for various automotive domains, including powertrain, body control, vehicle dynamics, energy management, Vehicle control unit, etc. 2. Develop embedded software in C for both RTOS and bare metal environments. 3. Perform hardware bring-up, code optimization, and system debugging. 4. Demonstrate working knowledge of ISO 26262 functional safety integrity levels. 5. Understand and apply RTOS concepts like booting, scheduling algorithms, memory management, resource distribution, power management, etc. 6. Apply technical safety concepts such as RAM test, ROM test, Lockstep, CPU test, MPU, and OS configurations (preferred). 7. Utilize experience with 16/32-bit MCUs from NXP, TI, Renesas, Microchip, etc., with different MCU architectures. 8. Work with communication protocols such as CAN(-FD), J1939, UDS, Automotive Ethernet, SPI, UART, I2C. 9. Troubleshoot and conduct root cause analysis of issues in integration, release-testing, and deployment of Classic AUTOSAR stack into use cases. 10. Work with AUTOSAR Classic and BSW stack configuration, and perform code generation using tools such as EB Tresos and Vector DaVinci. 11. Contribute to AUTOSAR-compliant Auto Code Generation process using Embedded Coder/TargetLink. 12. Implement and optimize Controller Area Network (CAN) communication protocols for seamless data exchange within the vehicle's network. 13. Develop and integrate Basic Software (BSW) modules to enhance the functionality and performance of the Vehicle Control Unit. 14. Implement Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) and Inter-Integrated Circuit (I2C) communication protocols for efficient data transfer between embedded systems. 15. Implement diagnostic-level coding for effective fault detection and resolution in collaboration with the vehicle's diagnostic systems. 16. Design and develop User Interface (UI) elements for diagnostic-level coding, ensuring a user- friendly and efficient visualization of system diagnostics. Preferred candidate profile   1. Good working knowledge of SDLC. Familiarity with Autosar architecture, Functional Safety, and FMEA. 2. Experience between 5-7 years. 3. Proficient in Model-Based Development and Validation in Automotive Domain B, 2 to 4 years of Experience in MATLAB, Simulink, State flow and Embedded C, C. 4. Good problem-solving and analytical skills and Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 5. Good knowledge in Validation: Model in Loop, Software in Loop F, Test automation using MATLAB scripting, Python, or any scripting language, Knowledge of SDLC. 6. Desirable experience with OCPP, ISO15118 standards. 7. Extensive experience with Vector CAN Tools (CANalyzer, CANoe), Ethernet tools, Emulators, Debuggers, and Compilers. 9. Comprehensive experience with software Version Control Tools - GIT (preferred), SVN, etc Perks and benefits
column11: Embedded C++, AUTOSAR, Embedded C, Simulink, MATLAB

column2: Leverage advanced physic-based simulation for virtual product/process development for faster and stronger innovation.                      Identify      and introduce the state-of-art technology to transform the way of working in PepsiCo R&D and enhance efficiency.                    Responsibilities                  Deliver modeling and simulation projects using general purpose and specialized numerical software.                    Design and develop innovative experiments to      validate      and improve models.              Support      senior simulation engineers on assigned simulation tasks including CAD creation, CAD cleaning, meshing, pre-processing, post processing, creating visuals of data              Work with external partners, software vendor, university, engineering firms, to develop technologies needed to fulfil PepsiCo need.              Additional responsibilities in combining physics-based simulation, sensor technology, data analytics (AI/ML) to deliver digitized innovation projects (digital twin)      , Support Computational Chemistry projects by data collection and literature research              New technology      introduction and implementation,                Technology adoption and communication in the experience lab (CAVE as part of the HUB) for immersive virtual-reality consumer-centric innovation.                    Qualifications                  Ph.D. with simulation concentration and 1+ years of work experience      , MS with 3+      years experience                      Hands-on experience with commercial software - CFD (ANSYS FLUENT, STAR-CCM+), FEA (ABAQUS, ANSYS Mechanical), DEM (ROCKY, EDEM), COMSOL.                      Knowledge about computational chemistry (hands on software experience with MOE,      Shrodinger      a plus)                      Experience designing and conducting physical testing required to formulate and/or calibrate models, i.e., Wind tunnel, mechanical testing, thermal measurements, Data Acquisition, High speed imagery, etc.                      Experience with Python, MATLAB, R, JMP a plus.                      Experience with VR/AR assets creation using      KeyShot      , Unity, Unreal, or Omniverse a plus.                      Knowledge and experience in food/beverage production and process engineering a plus extrusion, drying, frying, mixing, filling, food safety.                      Strong project management and communication skills.                      Ability to collaborate with internal and external partners in a global setup.                      Robust understanding of engineering      principle      with experience      in the area of      fluid dynamics,      thermodynamics      and heat transfer      .                      Experience with      state-of-the-art      modeling software      that      capable      to model      multi-physics      problem      involving multi-phase fluid flow and heat transfer in engineering and manufacturing processes.                      Knowledge of how to use simulation to evaluate new and novel technologies for PepsiCo s innovation      in processing/packaging      .

column2: Position:  Senior Windows Developer - Graphics and Analysis  Reports to:  Research and Development Manager  Type:  Permanent full time, 45 hours/wk, Monday-Friday  Responsibilities:   Create production-quality Windows applications for a market where reliability and ease of use is critical.   Primary responsibility for the graphics and analysis components of ERLPhase products.   Analyze new feature requirements, perform high level and detailed design, implement code, and unit test to realize the feature.   Add functionality to existing systems while maintaining the integrity of the existing software architecture and user experience.   Work with the embedded software team to review and approve API specifications.   Work with the Product Architect, or designate, to review and approve UI specifications.   Ensure that issues found during verification/validation testing, or by customers, are resolved quickly and efficiently.   Provide task estimates and status updates as required.   Review code created by other developers as required.   Provide technical guidance and mentorship to more junior developers.   Product release and version management.   Provide input into the development of formal verification plans.   Provide technical support to customer service staff and end users as required for escalated issues.   Other duties as assigned.  Skills and Qualifications:   Education: Bachelor of Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related degree or diploma.   Strong understanding of graphics theory, coordinate translation, color mapping and font management.   Strong understanding of Device Context and Logical Context mapping including scaling and translation.   Strong understanding of resource management and shared resources.   Strong understanding of Bit Block Transfer (BLT), Image Masking, and In-Memory Images.   Strong understanding of highly Object-Oriented C++.   Strong understanding of Data processing, Data Structures for recordings including methods for file storage, concatenation, and retrieval.   Broad knowledge of the software development process and technologies with an agile mindset.   Knowledge of software architecture and design patterns.   Passionate about creating excellent products.   Proven ability to drive projects and assignments to successful completion.   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.   Able to provide creative and sound solutions to problems.   Able to evaluate solutions with a critical eye.   Excellent interpersonal, oral and written English communication skills.   Ability to work independently or closely with others. A team player.   Strong time management skills and able to work in a dynamic environment with multiple simultaneous assignments and priorities.   Proven ability to quickly learn new skills and assume new responsibilities.   Committed to personal growth and development of new skills.   Experience: 10+ years of relevant software development with experience in:  Designing for the Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) for both screen and print rendering.  Object oriented design and C++ implementation. o  MFC UI design and development. o  C# in .NET Framework is an asset. o  Complex, interactive graphing applications. o  Experience with post-analysis tools is an asset. o  Large, complex software environments. o  Development for Microsoft Windows operating systems. o  Use of source code control tools. o  Use of software packaging and installation tools.
column11: C#, C++, VC++, MFC, GDI, Java, .NET, Ui Design Principles

column2: JD: wavespace Process Facilitator_ Supervising Associate The opportunity? As the wavespace content facilitator of the EY wavespace team you will have the opportunity to support the engagement of high priority local, regional, and global clients to understand and address some of their largest and most complex performance challenges, and ultimately improve and drive sustainable business results. We enable organizations to identify and address their most critical issues, ranging from strategic direction and alignment, digital disruption, and organizations responses to the pace of change whether technological, political, or societal in nature. Whilst the nature of our work focuses on supporting the design and facilitation of collaborative events, the competencies required is a diverse and challenging blend of logical problem solving and innovative thinking. Good communication skills, psychology, an open and inquisitive mind, and a fundamental desire to enable the capabilities of others to reach resolutions. In terms of skills facilitation is grounded in several methodologies of which Design Thinking is core but equally critical are project and program management, change management and a depth of understanding across the entire consulting value chain. As the public face of EY wavespace, it is expected that the candidate will confidently engage and influence diverse groups of internal and external stakeholders to support wavespace as a powerful and clearly differentiated facility, capability, and brand within the GDS Your key responsibilities In this role, you will have the opportunity to provide strategic and client relationship management support to wavespace. The responsibilities will also include co-developing and executing strategy and demand generation plan wavespace Trivandrum in close collaboration with the GDS Account Leaders, GDS Service Line leaders and Global wavespace locations. You will act as a facilitator and a research specialist supporting wavespace facilitators/experience managers who can provide content, structure the workshops, design sprints and brainstorming sessions. A consultative mindset, pre-sales activities, strong selling skills, a flair for creative marketing are prerequisites for the proposed role. Whilst the nature of the work focuses on the positioning wavespace and growing wavespace experiences, collaborative events as a GDS offering. The competencies required is a diverse and challenging blend of logical problem solving, innovative thinking, and political astuteness. To be successful in this role you will have some experience in both digital transformation and corporate innovation, preferably with domain expertise across key sectors but more importantly have a demonstrated ability to work with early-stage technology and large-scale incumbent businesses alike. A technical background in user research, secondary research primarily on the areas of strategy, experience design and digital technology is extremely advantageous to the role.   Responsibilities, Qualifications, Certifications - External More specifically, the successful candidate should: Manage all aspects of a session/ workshop Curate & design ?content ?relevant to the session and the objectives of the workshop Conduct user research based on design thinking methods Before a session that will include: location selection and rental, kit rental, detailed session design, detailed logistics planning, video / scribe hire and briefing, client team liaison, Mural design and creation, template design and creation, creating the IOM with the client team During a session this will include: ensuring all logistics are in place, all technology is delivered and functions, all activities are planned, all material is available After a session this will include: organizing the breakdown of the kit and its collection, writing up the session outcome, completing the credential write up, ensuring videos are completed and published, liaising with the scribe for any follow-on activities Develop and nurture relationships with onshore clients/sponsors and internal/external stakeholders based on strong understanding of their evolving business priorities and expectations Cross-sell/upsell opportunities to increase wavespace penetration End-to-end management of visits of clients/sponsors  conceptualize themes, project-manage preparation activities, manage experience, moderate the engagement, steer resulting opportunities to closure Drive execution of action plans and conversion of opportunities from client visits/workshops/meetings with global wavespace stakeholders To qualify for the role, you must have demonstrable experience in: At least 7+ years professional experience in a management consulting or other professional services environment - Experience in these with Big 4 firms will be an added advantage. Strong facilitation and presentation skills with at least 2+ years of experience in facilitating workshops, design thinking sessions, hackathons etc. Bachelor?? degree in any discipline. Master?? degree preferred. Cross-sector and cross-border knowledge and experience across the business value chain Strong digital product and service development experience ideally in a start-up or corporate innovation context Project Management Design Thinking Customer Experience mapping/journey mapping Adopt a consultative /partnering approach with stakeholders; ability to ??ear many hats??on the job Comfortable working independently as well as in a team Basic understanding of Japanese language would be an added advantage
column11: Innovation, Market research, Design Thinking, Training, Strategic Thinking, Innovation Management, Learning And Development, strategic researcher

column2: Project Role : Mechanical Engineering Practitioner Project Role Description : Design, analyze and build structures, machines, devices, systems and mechanical processes. Generate, build and test functional prototypes to validate feasibility. Identify opportunities for technological innovation.  Must have skills : 3D Modeling Good to have skills : Automotives, Automotive Engineering, creo, team center Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : B E or B Tech or M E or M tech in mechanical engineering Job Location : Gurgaon (onsite deputation at Client Site) What you would do in this role Minimum 5 to 8 year of experience in Vehicles Design Part and Integration on Creo platform. Min 3 years' experience in Automotive On-Highway or Off-Highway Segment Casting components manufacturing for Off Highway or On Highway components. 3D modelling of parts Casting Components 2D drafting of parts without error as per organization Guidelines. Part drawing, assembly drawing and specification release as per organization Standard practice. Creo solid & surface module, Expertise in Casting Modeling per Core/Cavity Method, Expertise in 2D for Complex casting components Exposure in using design tool like DFMEA, DMU, ECO/ECR processing and design calculation. Good understanding of Casting Design & Calculation, Stack-Up Analysis and General Dimensioning & Tolerances Analysis the issue/Problem and find out the solution by using the best design practice like stack-up Analysis, etc. Visual mockup Enovia, Creo, DMU, TCaE, Vis Mockup. Co-ordinate with inter-departments of New Assembly operation for manufacturing & Validation and resolve issues with Process Team Follow up with External/internal stakeholders for design reviews. Able to guide and help the people working in the same team. Others:Good communication, Sound mind, eager to learn new technology, Adaptable, Punctual, hardworking, MS-office, Presentation skills, Written English proficient, Verbal English proficient Who are we looking for?The person should be independent & experienced in handling Casting components for Tractor domain. He should be expert in Creo, Vis Mockup, Team center tools & change management process. The person should be aware of Design quality procedures such as DFMEA or 5steps or 7 steps problem resolution methods. Should be able complete given assignments with little mentoring & monitoring. The person needs to have previous experience in working for On Highway / Off Highway segment. Qualification B E or B Tech or M E or M tech in mechanical engineering

column2: As an R&D Specialist III specializing in Coil & Extrusion Coatings, you will play a crucial role in advancing our research and development efforts in the field of coil and extrusion coatings. This position requires a deep understanding of coating technologies, application methods, and performance requirements for metal substrates used in architectural, automotive, and industrial applications. You will lead the development of innovative coating formulations, optimize existing products, and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to meet the evolving needs of our customers and the industry. Key Responsibilities: Research and Development: Lead the research and development activities focused on coil and extrusion coatings. Conduct literature reviews, design experiments, and explore novel approaches to enhance coating performance, durability, and sustainability. Formulation Development: Conceptualize, develop, and optimize coating formulations tailored for specific applications, substrates, and performance requirements. Evaluate raw materials, additives, and pigments for their compatibility and effectiveness in coating systems. Application Technology: Stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in coating application methods, including coil coating, spray coating, and powder coating. Collaborate with manufacturing and engineering teams to scale up new formulations and optimize application processes. Performance Testing: Design and execute performance tests to evaluate coating properties, including adhesion, corrosion resistance, weatherability, and color stability. Analyze test data, identify areas for improvement, and implement corrective actions to meet quality standards and customer specifications. Quality Assurance: Establish quality control protocols for incoming raw materials, in-process samples, and finished products. Conduct regular inspections and audits to ensure compliance with internal standards, industry regulations, and customer requirements. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain detailed records of experimental procedures, formulation recipes, test results, and technical reports. Prepare presentations and documentation to communicate project updates, findings, and recommendations to internal stakeholders and clients. Project Management: Manage multiple R&D projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and allocate resources effectively to meet project milestones and timelines. Coordinate with cross-functional teams, including product development, marketing, and sales, to ensure alignment with business objectives.
column11: Project Management, Research and Development, Performance Testing, Formulation Development, Quality Assurance, Application Technology

column2: The SLR Program at WRI India is seeking a Senior Program Research Specialist Behavioral Science, Sustainable Landscapes and Restoration to support the ongoing work on food loss and waste. Larger focus of the work would be to catalyze systems change with a focus on circular food systems in India. With an aim to inspire, engage and mobilize action on food loss and food waste in two large states in India as a critical lever to test and pilot strategies - powered by robust evidence and consultations. Centering your focus on equity and inclusion, your role would be to build evidence-based strategies to reduce food loss and waste to stir action and behavioral change. And identify innovative solutions that can enhance livelihoods and improve access to nutritious food by addressing barriers to food loss and food waste.        How your day will unfold:     The position is most suited to an individual who has a specialized degree in behaviour science and has a passion for working in the food sustainability, natural resource management in India. The position holder must be willing to travel to remote locations in the country as well as internationally as necessary.          Research (70%)           Developing behavioral science informed research strategies for reducing food loss and food waste, and ongoing food, land and waste transition work at WRI India. This would include undertaking research, developing research frameworks, and behavior science informed strategies to reduce food loss and waste for a diverse stakeholders across the food supply chain.     Developing high-quality knowledge products (reports, policy briefs, working papers) that encapsulate research findings and communicate these to diverse audiences, for influencing initiatives on reducing food loss and food waste in India.     Stay updated on international and national issues on food loss and food waste and propose strategic opportunities for the program that aligns with strategy.       Partnerships, engagement and communication (30%)         Work closely with food, land and water transition team in WRI India to incorporate behavioral issues in ongoing research.     Support with development of communication and outreach strategy and material like brochures, web content, op-eds, blogs considering behavioral norms and nudges for food and sustainability with the communications team.     Support with program/proje     ct performance against contract     ual     requirements for the project      management      team.             Qualifications and requirements we seek:           Master s degree (or PhD) in behavioral science in food, agriculture, and natural resource management sector or any related disciplines.     At least 7 years post-study research experience relating to behavioral science in food, agriculture, and natural resource management sector     Demonstrated ability to work both independently as well as part of an interdisciplinary team     Demonstrated skills of engaging in participatory approaches, and high levels of comfort in working with scientific data as well as local knowledge. Proficiency in quantitative and qualitative data analysis is a requirement.     Excellent/ Strong research, interpersonal/ written/ communication skills     Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner     Ability to work calmly and enthusiastically under high pressure and ability to think creatively      Demonstrated skills preparing programme documents, reports, policy briefs etc. and team management.     General awareness of the environment, restoration, agriculture and food domain - key issues, events and updates is essential      Strong ability to communicate clearly and effectively in conversation and writing, including professional-quality writing for policy and communications products.     Fluency in spoken and written English is essential. Additional proficiency in Hindi and Marathi will be advantageous.     Ability to take the initiative, brainstorm, think creatively, juggle multiple priorities and work under pressure with tight deadlines. The candidate must be willing to try new approaches and ideas and be innovative.     Flexible and self-motivated, with capacity to multi-task and prioritize, a self-starter having ability to manage the tasks with minimum guidance     Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint is a requirement.

column2: Research Project Management:     Collaborate with faculty members and research teams to define research objectives, methodologies, and timelines for projects.   Assist in the planning, design, and execution of research studies, ensuring adherence to ethical guidelines and regulatory requirements.   Coordinate data collection activities, recruit participants, and manage research logistics as needed.   Data Collection and Analysis:     Collect, compile, and organize data from various sources, including surveys, interviews, literature reviews, and databases.   Conduct quantitative and qualitative data analysis using statistical software (e.g., SPSS, R, SAS) and qualitative analysis tools (e.g., NVivo, ATLAS.ti).   Interpret research findings, identify patterns and trends, and draw actionable insights to inform decision-making and programmatic improvements.   Report Writing and Presentation:     Prepare research reports, white papers, and presentations summarizing research findings, methodologies, and implications.   Communicate research results to stakeholders, including faculty, administrators, policymakers, and funding agencies, through written reports and oral presentations.   Collaborate with research team members to disseminate research findings through academic publications, conference presentations, and other channels.   Literature Review and Synthesis:     Conduct literature reviews and synthesize findings from existing research studies to inform the design and implementation of new research projects.   Stay updated on current trends, best practices, and emerging issues in relevant fields of study, providing insights and recommendations for future research directions.   Data Management and Documentation:     Maintain organized and secure data repositories, ensuring data integrity, confidentiality, and compliance with data protection regulations (e.g., FERPA).   Document research protocols, methodologies, and procedures to facilitate replication and transparency in research activities.   Collaboration and Teamwork:     Collaborate effectively with interdisciplinary research teams, including faculty, graduate students, research assistants, and external collaborators.   Contribute to a positive and collaborative work environment, sharing knowledge, skills, and resources to achieve research goals and objectives.   Professional Development:     Engage in professional development activities, including workshops, seminars, and training programs, to enhance research skills, methodologies, and domain knowledge.   Pursue opportunities for publication, grant writing, and conference presentations to advance your professional development and contribute to the scholarly community.
column11: Quantitative Analysis, Qualitative Analysis, Research Analysis, Data Analysis, Data Collection, Market Research

column2: Are you looking to make a real difference on a global scale       As a Senior Associate in C-Quest Capital s Carbon and Sustainability Accounting Team (CSAT),          you will have the opportunity to work on methodology development, methodology applications to new concepts, assist in transformational and sustainable strategies, assist in developing monitoring survey and design sampling approaches across various regions in a truly global, multicultural workspace           The Carbon and Sustainability Accounting Team (CSAT),       is responsible for all aspects of carbon and sustainability accounting and compliance management for CQC s growing portfolio of projects, which currently number more than 90 projects and growing     CQC is active in a number of different carbon verticals in both reductions and avoidance including household devices, fuel switching, industrial energy efficiency, renewable energy, avoided methane emissions and methane capture and use, as well as nature-based carbon credits, including, but not limited to those associated with bamboo afforestation, restoration forestry, farmer managed natural restoration, assisted natural restoration, other forms of regenerative agriculture and sustainable forestry management and soil carbon accumulation              Key Responsibilities:                           Providing technical support in project conceptualization, planning, implementation, and monitoring with respect to the guidelines outlined under the GHG crediting program.             Support developing new business ideas and concepts which help in expanding the CQC portfolio in new regions both geographically and technologically.             Perform literature review on new concepts, technologies, methodology development etc and provide summarized report(s).              Assist in development of calculation approach for emission reduction calculation.              Providing technical support during baseline data collection, data analysis, validation and verification activities etc             Assisting in planning and development of data collection tools such as developing questionnaires designed to understand baseline scenarios and monitoring project activities in different countries.                The successful candidate must have experience working in a carbon/ climate change domain.                  Prior experience would include:                   3+ years of relevant working experience in a carbon market, with research experience a plus.             In-depth understanding of various GHG crediting programs such as the Clean Development Mechanism (CDM), Verified Carbon Standard (VCS), SD VISta, Gold Standard, Article 6 etc             Demonstrated knowledge of sampling approaches for household energy efficiency projects.             Working experience with a multi-country/multi-cultural team and/or with developmental agencies.              Strong attention to detail.             Experience in carbon project methodology development is preferred.             Minimum of a Bachelor s degree.             A master s degree in the field of energy and/or environment, engineering is preferred.               Key Skills/Abilities   :                         Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize and deliver efficiently and effectively under deadlines.             Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills and the ability to articulate their communications when reporting/representing data clearly and concisely.             Ability to coordinate with teams spread across different locations in India, Africa, Southeast Asia.             A passion to actively help the rural poor in less developed countries in line with the UN Sustainable Development Goals.             Good numerate skills.             An ability to fit in with the high-performance and collaborative culture of CQC.             An ability to self-manage day to day activities.                       Travel   :       The expectation is that the Senior Associate will have occasional travel in the operating regions, but the majority of the time this role will be Delhi-based.

column2: Job Title Executive / Senior Executive - Product Development About Godrej Agrovet Godrej Agrovet Limited (GAVL) is a diversified, Research & Development focused Agri- business Company, dedicated to improving the productivity of Indian farmers by innovating products and services that sustainably increase crop and livestock yields. GAVL holds leading market positions in the different businesses in which it operates - Animal Feed, Crop Protection, Oil Palm, Dairy and Poultry and Processed Foods. With FY 18- 19 Sales of 6000 Crore INR, GAVL has a pan India presence with sales of over a million tons annually of high-quality feed and cutting-edge nutrition products for cattle, poultry, aqua feed and specialty feed. Apart from these businesses, the Company has a joint venture with the ACI group of Bangladesh for animal feed business in Bangladesh. Godrej Agrovet has 50 manufacturing facilities across India with a network of 10,000 rural distributors/dealers and over 2500 employees. Role & responsibilities    Candidate will be responsible to manage more than one state as Product development in-charge and conduct R&D trials (Insecticide, Fungicide, Herbicide, Nematicide, Acaricide, PGR's, PN). 1. Field selection 2. Layout, Trial execution and Observation 3. Report Preparation, Statistical analysis, Presentation 4. Project management 5. Managing and training team members 6. Self Updating through literature/scientific meetings Preferred candidate profile   B.Sc. (Agri) + M.Sc. in Agricultural Sciences (Preferably Pathology, Weed Science) Over 5 years experience of conducting multilocation R&D field trials in different crops against different pests. Sound knowledge of crop-pest calendar and agrochemical used.   Division: Crop Protection Business Qualification:   B.Sc. (Agri) + M.Sc. in Agricultural Sciences (Preferably Pathology, Weed Science)  Experience: 5-8 years Location:  Meerut and Hapur

column2: The Global Solution Owner is a member of the Mondelez Digital Services (MDS) Digital RD Team supporting the digital needs with two teams in RD: Consumer Science Knowledge Management. Research Associates will be stationed at the IPFs Delhi office but will be required to travel to various states. Detailed job description is available on https://www.policefoundationindia.org/careers Qualifications: Essential: Bachelors degree in Law /Police Sciences/Social Sciences / Business Administration. column2: As the Head of R&D, you will lead the research and development initiatives, play a critical role in shaping KHMDLs future through innovation and technology leadership. Your expertise will be essential in driving the company's success and maintaining our competitive edge in the marketplace. Driving innovation, creating new products, enhancing current products, and making sure the business stays on the cutting edge of technology breakthroughs in the sector are all under your purview. RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for Research & Development of Thick Film Hybrid Micro Circuits, Power Devices, Embedded Systems and Control Electronics Across Aerospace, Defence, Automotive & Consumer Durable Products. Strategic Planning:  Develop and execute R&D strategies aligned with the company's overall objectives and long-term goals New Product Development:  Lead the research and development of new products or technologies from concept to commercialization. Technology Assessment:  Stay abreast of emerging technologies, trends, and competitors in the industry. Evaluate new technologies and assess their potential impact on the company's product portfolio and business strategy. Process Improvement:  Continuously optimize R&D processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency, reduce development cycle times, and improve product quality. Implement best practices and tools to streamline workflows and increase productivity. Cross-functional Collaboration:  Work closely with other departments such as product management, engineering, manufacturing, marketing, and sales to ensure alignment and integration of R&D efforts with overall business objectives. Foster a collaborative and innovative culture across teams. Resource Management:  Manage R&D budgets, resources, and personnel effectively to support project goals and timelines. Allocate resources strategically, prioritize projects and monitor expenditures to ensure optimal use of resources. Talent Development:  Recruit, hire, mentor, and develop R&D staff to build a high-performing team capable of delivering innovative solutions. Provide guidance, support, and opportunities for professional growth and career advancement. Quality Assurance and Regulatory Compliance:  Ensure that R&D activities comply with relevant industry regulations, standards, and quality management systems. Collaborate with regulatory affairs and quality assurance teams to facilitate product approvals, certifications, and compliance with regulatory requirements. External Partnerships:  Foster strategic partnerships, collaborations, and alliances with external organizations, research institutions, and technology providers to enhance R&D capabilities, access new markets, and accelerate innovation. Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and uncertainties associated with R&D projects / existing product line and develop mitigation strategies to minimize their impact on project outcomes, timelines, and impact of change in technology. Reporting and Performance Metrics:  Track and report on key performance indicators (KPIs), milestones, and progress against R&D goals and objectives. Provide regular updates and insights to senior management and stakeholders. REQUIREMENT: Advanced degree (Ph.D./ M.S/ME/MTech.) in Electronics, or a related field. Extensive experience (10+ years) in R&D roles within the thick film industry/Aerospace & Defence Industry, with a track record of successful product development and innovation. Strong technical expertise in thick film materials, Electronic Components, circuit designs, processes, and applications. Knowledge of the vendor base and Manufacturers of critical electronic and electro mechanical components. Knowledge of electronic Manufacturing processes including PCB assemblies and testing. Proven leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate cross-functional teams. Excellent project management capabilities, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage timelines, and allocate resources effectively. Strategic thinker with a keen business acumen and the ability to identify market opportunities and drive growth. Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.

column2: The Post-Doctoral Fellow will be a part of an interdisciplinary research team working on climate change adaptation, changing rural and urban livelihoods and landscapes, and human migration. Contributing to multiple projects at the intersection of climate change and migration, the Fellow will be expected to work with secondary and primary quantitative data to measure, map and project demographic transitions at national and sub-national levels; build and analyse datasets related to climate change, extreme events, and environmental change; and develop a pipeline of peer reviewed publications from the work.         Activities and Tasks       Responsibilities would include, but not be limited to, the following:       Conceptualising and anchoring research related to migration and climate change in India, with a focus on quantitative data analysis, and climate and demographic modelling;         Conducting a literature review on the above topics, with the aim of producing a peer-reviewed publication and a summary of methodological approaches being used in the literature;         Developing a methodology note on climate change and migration data in India;         Assisting with writing proposals for new projects and helping expand the climate change portfolio;         Developing a teaching case based on the above research for IIHS teaching and training programs;         Independently developing at least one written output per year which can include journal articles, commentary pieces, reports, policy papers and briefs, shorter articles for popular media, etc;         Providing support in project management and other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations and others;         Participating in all activities of Institution-Building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within or outside the country as and when needed.         Structure and Reporting        The Post-Doctoral Fellow will report to a Senior Consultant of the School of Environment and Sustainability, and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and external individuals/organizations, and students.         Person Specification       We are looking for a bright and enthusiastic person willing to develop cutting-edge research at the intersection of climate change, migration, and demographic transitions. While part of an interdisciplinary team including development studies, economics, agriculture, climate change, environmental sciences, architecture, urban planning etc., the Fellow is expected to build out policy-relevant evidence base on climate change and migration in India.     Strong quantitative data analysis skills, creativity to work in data-scarce environments, and an interest to work across disciplinary boundaries is essential for the role. While building one s own work and publications, the candidate should be open to work for project-specific deliverables and deadlines, as well as support in mentoring junior team members.     Applicants should have:       A PhD degree (or submitted PhD thesis) in population studies, climate change, environmental science, or economics (with a migration or climate focused thesis), with demonstrated knowledge/ experience of quantitative data analysis and/ or demographic modelling;         Proficiency in software such as STATA, R, SPSS; experience in designing and deploying quantitative sample surveys; and creative data visualization are essential;         Prior research experience related to migration, climate change, environmental geography or related topics is desirable;         Previous publications and/ or conference presentations/ talks on related topics is an advantage;         Previous experience working with researchers or practitioners on related topics is an advantage.
column11: Economics, Data analysis, Environmental science, Urban planning, Project management, Post Doctoral Fellow, SPSS, data visualization, Research, Sustainable development

column1: R&D Engineer II - C++, DSA (SCBU Bangalore)
column2: When visionary companies need to know how their world-changing ideas will perform, they close the gap between design and reality with Ansys simulation. For more than 50 years, Ansys software has enabled innovators across industries to push boundaries by using the predictive power of simulation. From sustainable transportation to advanced semiconductors, from satellite systems to life-saving medical devices, the next great leaps in human advancement will be powered by Ansys. Take a leap of certainty  with Ansys. Summary / Role Purpose The engineer will join SeaScape Research and Development team that creates state of the art software for semiconductor analysis. ANSYS RedHawk-SC is the first ANSYS product based on the new SeaScape Elastic Compute Architecture for Electronic Design Automation (EDA). Designed to handle extremely large data sets and computations across distributed machines, ANSYS RedHawk-SC allows designers of advanced system-on- chip designs (SoCs) to assess more electromigration (EM) and voltage drop (IR) scenarios per day and develop a high-level of confidence of their design sign-off. Key Duties and Responsibilities Demonstrate a solid understanding of the code and the teams software development processes. Work with manager and others to define and implement new capabilities. Once projects are defined, the engineer should be able to deliver medium sized projects with minimal input from others. Diagnose and fix code problems. Deliver code that meets requirements on schedule. Ensure that code is efficient, scalable, maintainable, extensible, robust and easy to understand. Optimize code to improve tool run time and memory capacity. Create unit, regression and/or system-level tests to thoroughly validate new features or changes. Communicate clearly and work closely with manager, technical leads and other engineers to refine solutions and to describe changes that may affect others. Understand and demonstrate best practices in software engineering. Be a source of expertise for others in the project team. We fuel new ideas, build relationships, and help each other realize our greatest potential in the knowledge that every day is an opportunity to observe, teach, inspire, and be inspired. Together as One Ansys, we are powering innovation that drives human advancement. Our Commitments: Amaze with innovative products and solutions Make our customers incredibly successful Act with integrity Ensure employees thrive and shareholders prosper Our Values: Adaptability: Be open, welcome whats next Courage: Be courageous, move forward passionately Generosity: Be generous, share, listen, serve Authenticity: Be you, make us stronger Our Actions: We commit to audacious goals We work seamlessly as a team We demonstrate mastery We deliver outstanding results OUR ONE ANSYS CULTURE HAS INCLUSION AT ITS CORE We believe diverse thinking leads to better outcomes. We are committed to creating and nurturing a workplace that fuels this by welcoming people, no matter their background, identity, or experience, to a workplace where they are valued and where diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging thrive. TAKE A LEAP OF CERTAINTY IN YOUR CAREER AT ANSYS At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary leaders across the globe. Collectively we strive to change the world with innovative technology and transformational solutions. With a prestigious reputation in working with well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head on. And its about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can, and do impact real people in real ways.
