column2: The research impact and communications specialist will be part of an interdisciplinary team of researchers working on climate change and migration, and responsible for anchoring multimedia research impact strategy, project-level public engagement activities, strategic communication of project outputs, and anchoring project brand design      As part of the team, the incumbent s involvement will include the creation and implementation of a strategic communication and dissemination plan with a focus on driving impact through narrative change (ie, using communications and evidence-based outreach on climate change and migration to translate research into impact)      The role will require working in close coordination with the IIHS Communications and Design team, Word Lab and Media Lab to ensure that project communications are harmonised with the core communication strategy and design at the institutional level      There are two positions open for this role, one focussing on urban areas and one on rural areas      These are contractual positions for an initial term of 11 months, renewable on mutual consent, with the potential to turn into a regular position over time                          Activities and Tasks          Leading overall strategic communication and dissemination planning including, but not limited to, a communications strategy for the project period differentiated by stakeholder groups, diversity of communications outputs including multimedia material and communication of findings for wide uptake;          Working closely with multiple local and internal partners in co-anchoring research impact tasks including developing a strategy to design and disseminate knowledge products and anchoring public-facing national and international events and workshops;          Working closely in and with the research team to co-develop a research impact strategy including planning and implementing activities for narrative change around climate migration; this will involve working with multiple stakeholders, designing and conducting participatory workshops, and understanding and anchoring need-based, evidence-based knowledge products;          Supporting the research team in creating tailored outputs and research-to-action activities at community, (sub-)national, and international levels in various formats including written content, multimedia outputs, stakeholder engagement activities and network building;          Providing support to the research team in identifying the need for, and organizing, project events such as workshops and stakeholder consultations at multiple locations in India as needed;      Identification of appropriate avenues and design of relevant material for amplifying communication on project findings and increasing impact;          Collaborating with the IIHS Media Lab, Word Lab, and Communications & Design teams to create audio-visual content, and to develop material for wider dissemination; this will include supporting website development and website updates;      Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations and others;      Participating in all activities of Institution - Building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within or outside the country as and when needed.              Structure and Reporting        The research impact and communications specialist will be an External Consultant coordinating with the Senior Consultant - School of Environment and Sustainability (SES) at IIHS and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and network partners.            Person Specification        An ideal candidate should have:        An advanced degree (master s degree or equivalent) in communication, design, journalism, or development studies, with demonstrated knowledge/experience of climate change, environmental change, human geography or related fields;      3-5 years of work experience in design, communications, journalism, or related areas;      Ability to develop, design, and implement a creative and evidence-based approach to communications and dissemination aimed at multiple audiences, while ensuring ideals of inclusion and equity of multiple voices and ideas;      Ability to connect with people and liaise with researchers from partner organisations and assist them in translating knowledge generated through projects into action;      Experience of working with multilateral or bilateral agencies, donor-funded research projects, INGOs, think tanks, foundations, or consulting firms, on their outreach programmes would be an added advantage;      Excellent command of English; experience in writing for media or designing for multiple platforms; and the ability to write with precision and attention to detail; knowledge of regional languages like Odia/Malayalam/Kannada/Bengali would be an added advantage;      Understanding of the basic principles of design and the ability to suggest design requirements for various types of content, as the candidate will be working closely with graphic designers to create communication products.
column11: audio visual, Bengali, Stakeholder Engagement, Malayalam, communication design, Networking, Consulting, Journalism, Research, Sustainable development

column2: Our RD engineers and scientists continuously strive to develop breakthrough technologies in the areas of HVDC FACTS with the aim to provide our customers with products and services that help make them become more competitive while minimizing environmental impact.      Our RD Center in Chennai is focusing on development of innovative technologies in HVDC and is an integral part of global RD organization. The RD center concentrates on development of new technologies in the areas of semiconductors, converter design, main circuit design, converter control strategies, power system studies, etc. for HVDC applications.      This center works in close collaboration with RD teams in Sweden, Switzerland and participates in global RD projects. The center is also co-located With HVDC FACTS project engineering groups in Chennai, which gives a unique opportunity to the research engineers to interact and learn about the customer and market needs.           Your Responsibilities:         Eager to explore white spots of business and technology opportunities.     Able to work in a fuzzy context where different solutions (technical, process, organizational) are being evaluated and discussed, establishing structure as needed.     Sense of responsibility and problem solver.     Excellent written and verbal communication skills, Target oriented, pro-active, and self-motivated.     Communicative, convincing team-player.     Interpersonal skills and able to work in international team.     Encourages openness respect, and build trust, confidence loyalty with customers and partners.     Self-dependent and structured work, Creative innovation driver with strong ownership.     Living Hitachi Energy s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.             Your Background:         PHD in Electrical Engineering with focus on Power Electronics (or) M.TECH/M.E     4-5 years of relevant experience.     Knowledge on converter design, control, and modulation.     Knowledge of HVDC, FACTS Power Semiconductors devices.     Proficiency in simulation tools like PSCAD, MATLAB/Simulink.     Solid organizational skills including attention to detail, multi-tasking, and ability to prioritize effectively in a demanding environment.     Proficiency in both spoken written English language is required.

column2: The Senior Manager - Electric Mobility will work closely on an electric mobility index initiative at WRI India. Minimum 8-10 years of full-time experience working in the transportation/ urban development sectors.   Proficient at policy analysis and qualitative/ quantitative research methods.   Excellent analytical, writing and editing skills in English.   Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.   Ability to build and maintain productive relationships internally and externally.   Capability to communicate complex ideas in well-organized, everyday language. column2: The primary role of a Junior Research Fellow is to assist in research activities under the guidance of a Principal Investigator (PI) or a senior researcher. They work on specific research projects and contribute to the advancement of knowledge in their respective fields.        Some key responsibilities of a JRF include:        Research Work: Conduct literature reviews, experimental work, data collection, and data analysis as part of the research project.Project Assistance: Assist the PI or senior researchers in project planning, design, and execution.Data Interpretation: Analyze research data and interpret the results to draw meaningful conclusions.      Report Writing: Prepare research reports, papers, and presentations to communicate findings and progress to the research team and stakeholders.Continuous Learning: Keep abreast of the latest developments and advancements in the field of research.Proposal Writing: Contribute to writing research proposals to secure funding for future projects.      Collaboration: Collaborate with other researchers and team members to share knowledge and insights.Compliance: Ensure that research work is conducted in adherence to ethical guidelines and research protocols.Professional Development: Attend seminars, conferences, and workshops to enhance knowledge and research skills.

column2: We are in search of two motivated Junior Research Fellows (JRF) to become part of our dynamic team      As a JRF, you will be at the forefront of innovative research in soft exoskeleton development      Your role will involve designing, developing, and implementing novel control strategies for upper limb rehabilitation, with a specific emphasis on the hand and elbow joints      Collaboration with clinical partners and the use of rapid prototyping techniques will be essential components of your work                  Key Responsibilities:          Create and fabricate a wearable soft exoskeleton, prioritizing user mobility while maintaining compatibility with the human limb.      Contribute to the development of a robust control architecture for the exoskeleton, enabling targeted motion assistance.      Investigate a range of control strategies, including force and velocity fields, admittance and impedance control, and resistive and assistive fields in three-dimensional space.          Qualifications and Skills:          Qualifications:          Tech degree with a background or expertise in Robotics, Mechatronics, Controls, Electronics, or Mechanical Engineering.          Required Skills:          Proficiency in C++, Python, and Embedded C.      Experience with AutoDesk Inventor or CATIA.      Hands-on experience with hardware platforms such as Nvidia Jetson Nano, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, etc.      Familiarity with Matlab, Simulink, Simscape, and similar toolboxes.      Strong knowledge of robot control and programming.      Previous hands-on experience in building robotic systems, signal processing, EMG sensors          Desired Skills (a plus):          Strong proficiency in the English language.      Prior experience with torque sensors.      Familiarity with exoskeleton devices.      Understanding of human biomechanics.      A track record of publications showcasing expertise in the field or relevant industrial experience.          What You Will Gain:        As a JRF, you will have the opportunity to:        Independently design and analyze control requirements for complex upper limb exoskeletons.      Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams and clinicians, gaining invaluable real-world experience.      Contribute to pushing the boundaries of current technology, surpassing the capabilities of existing devices in the field.      Possibility to covert to PhD position (deserving candidates)

In this role, you will be responsible for the design and development of innovative and functional plastic products, from concept to completion. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, designers, and manufacturing personnel, to ensure the successful development and launch of new products.  Primary Job Responsibilities Design and develop plastic products using 3D CAD software (Solidworks /PTC Cero). Analyse and select appropriate materials based on product requirements, cost, and manufacturability. Perform Design for Manufacturability (DFM) analysis to ensure designs are optimized for production. Conduct Finite Element Analysis (FEA) to assess product strength and functionality. understanding of Design and Development of Injection molds/rubber/sheet metal components Understanding of Design and Development of Injection molds/rubber/sheet metal components Collaborate with engineers and Mold makers to design and develop tooling for injection molding. Conduct prototyping and testing to validate designs and identify potential issues before production. Work with manufacturing teams to ensure product quality and production efficiency. Stay up to date on new trends and technologies in plastics engineering. Prepare technical documentation, drawings, and reports.   Skill Sets Experience with moldflow analysis software. Knowledge of injection molding processes Strong understanding of design for sustainability principles Experience in consumer durable Home Appliance, Electronic goods, and automotive is appreciated.  Experience with Finite Element Analysis (FEA) software. Qualifications and Experience Bachelor's degree/ Diploma in Mechanical Engineering or Plastics Engineering. 3 to 7 years of experience in plastic product design and development. Proven track record of successfully designing and launching new plastic products. Strong knowledge in 3D CAD software (Solidworks, Creo) Knowledge of plastic materials, properties, and processing methods. Strong understanding of DFM principles and best practices. Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with secondary operations (e.g., finishing, assembly)   Industry preference -  Water Purifier, Home Appliance, Electronic Goods, Consumer Durables.
column11: 3D CAD, Plastic Molding, Plastic Product Design, Injection Moulding

column2: Hi, Greetings from Naxnova Technologies ! About Us:   We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative Material Scientist to join our team as Printed Electronics Engineer. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in the design, development, and optimization of printed electronics technologies (like EL, OLED displays etc.). Collaboration with a diverse team of engineers and researchers will be key as we strive to deliver cutting-edge solutions across various applications, including consumer electronics, automotive displays, wearable devices, and beyond. Positions Details- Title:  Material Scientist Location:  Vasai, Mumbai Salary:  No Bar for right candidate No. of Opening : 1 Job Specifications Responsibilities: 1. Research, evaluate, and identify new material suppliers within NAXNOVA, ensuring alignment with project requirements. 2. Identify dual source, low-cost material alternatives when necessary, maintaining quality standards and project timelines. 3. Create Material Task book to document material selection and testing processes. 4. Initiate material screening tests and analyse results to inform material selection decisions. 5. Request material costing information based on specific volumes for benchmarking purposes. 6. Establish process parameters in collaboration with manufacturing and process teams to ensure seamless integration of selected materials. 7. Lead material validation efforts, ensuring adherence to specifications and standards. 8. Take responsibility for material specification and Initial Sample Inspection Report (ISIR) documentation. 9. Collect Technical Data Sheets (TDS), Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS), and other relevant documentation as required. 10. Oversee the documentation process for final material release, ensuring accuracy and completeness. Requirements: 1. Master's or PhD in Materials Science, Physics, or related field. 2. Strong background in semiconductor physics, optoelectronics, and printed electronics. 3. Hands-on experience with design and fabrication of EL, OLED displays, and/or printed electronics. 4. Familiarity with manufacturing processes for flexible electronics, including printing, sintering, and encapsulation. 5. Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively. 6. Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams. 7. Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Preferred Qualifications: 1. Experience with display technologies (e.g., OLED) and their integration with printed electronics. 2. Knowledge of flexible substrates and barrier films for flexible electronics applications. 3. Experience in project management and technology transfer from research to production. 4. Understanding of reliability and lifetime issues in electronic devices and methods for mitigation. Join our dynamic team and contribute to the advancement of next generation display technologies and printed electronics!

column2: JOB TITLE  -  Clinical Research Associate LOCATION  -  New Delhi CONTRACT TYPE - Permanent (Open ended) Context and Role   Non-communicable diseases (NCDs) cause over 70% of all deaths worldwide each year. 85% of premature deaths due to NCDs are in low- and middle-income countries. The George Institute is focused on finding better treatments for the worlds biggest health problems including renal and cardiovascular diseases.   We are conducting large-scale clinical trials, often across multiple countries and clinical sites, and developing new medicine and technology solutions to prevent and treat common chronic and critical conditions with a global perspective.  Our work is transforming practice and improving health outcomes worldwide. A Clinical Research Associate (CRA) will work on trials testing new and existing drugs and will typically be involved in all stages of the clinical trial, including identifying an investigational site and setting up, initiating, monitoring and closing down the trial.  Reporting Relationships   Directly reports to the Associate Project Manager  Duties and Key Responsibilities The Clinical Research Associate would be expected to:  Assist in the development of trial related documents including but not limited to the protocol, investigators brochure, patient information documents and care report forms.  Coordinate with the ethics committee, which safeguards the rights, safety and wellbeing of all trial subjects.  assist in regulatory authority applications and approvals that oversee the research and marketing of new and existing drugs.  assess the suitability of facilities to use as the clinical trial site.  assist in the selection of an investigator who will be responsible for conducting the trial at the trial site.  liaise with doctors, consultants or investigators on conducting the trial  set up the trial sites - ensuring each centre has the trial materials, including the trial drug often known as the investigational medicinal product (IMP)  train the site staff to trial-specific standards  monitor the trial throughout its duration, which involves visiting the trial sites on a regular basis and dealing with and solving any issues.  verify that data entered on to the CRFs is consistent with patient clinical notes, known as source data/document verification (SDV)  collect completed CRFs from hospitals and general practices.  write visit reports and file and collate trial documentation and reports.  meet with team members to discuss on-going trials, results and any trends or adverse events.  ensure all unused trial supplies are accounted for.  close down trial sites on completion of the trial.  archive study documentation and correspondence.  prepare final reports for sponsors, regulatory authorities, and ethics committees.  As a Team Member:?   Participate in team meetings and activities relating to the TRACK trial and own work area;  Participate in special projects to improve processes, tools, systems and organisation;  Take responsibility for personal learning and development and for setting achievable and meaningful work objectives and managing personal targets, meeting obligations of the Institutes Performance Management and Development Policy;  Demonstrate commitment to GIs values, including performing to an exceptionally high ethical standard and focus on integrity, collaboration and teamwork in all efforts.?  Work, Health and Safety   Comply with GI??  Work Health and Safety Policy  and related procedures, and similar policies which apply when visiting the premises of affiliates and collaborating sites.  Promote and contribute to a safe, secure environment for staff and visitors.  Skills, Knowledge and Experience   Qualifications: Bachelors?in life sciences, medical sciences or nursing with masters degree in clinical research.  Experience of at least 2 years as a clinical research coordinator or 1 year as a clinical research associate.  Demonstrated experience in working with electronic data capture tools such as REDCap, OpenClinica, Zelta etc.  Willingness to travel to conduct frequent site monitoring visits.  Demonstrated capability to produce outcomes and achieve objectives within agreed time periods.  Strong problem solving, analytical skills, and proven strategic thinking.  Demonstrated resourcefulness, with ability to influence others to achieve common goals.  Excellent interpersonal skills with high level of proficiency in English and the ability to work well autonomously.  Excellent team-workskills, with demonstrated ability to collaborate in small teams and with a wide range of varying stakeholders.  Ability to demonstrate flexibility and to be adaptable to changing organisational priorities and ambiguous environments.  Strong focus on producing the highest quality of work and on ensuring optimum accuracy of outputs. Well organised and efficient, with the capacity to work under pressure. How to apply:   Interested candidates should send their resume with full contact details, current and expected CTC/salary. Clearly mentioning the job title ??Clinical Research Associate (CRA) ??in the subject line to  hrindia@georgeinstitute.org.in  by the  16 June 2024 .
column11: CRA, Clinical Research, Data Management, Clinical Trials

column2: Product Development and Vendor Development Specialist **Company:** ANB Enterprises   **Website:** [https://alterstar.in/](https://alterstar.in/)   **Salary:** 10,000 to 30,000 per month   **Contact:** 9079853002 **Location:** N-31, DSIIDC Industrial Area, Sector 2, Bawana, Delhi, 110039  About the Company: Offering targeted solutions with a high level of experience and expertise, ANB Enterprises is a pioneer engineering enterprise specifically serving the automobile aftermarket industry. Since our inception in 2018, we have been harnessing our technological know-how, expertise, and experience to offer premium quality products. We are a preferred supplier of Starters, Alternators, and their spares in the Indian and South Asian automobile aftermarket. With a pan-India presence, we manufacture starters, alternators, and their spares for a vast range of cars, heavy-duty trucks, buses, cranes, and tractors. Registered under the brand name ALTER-STAR, ANB Enterprises is not limited by challenges. Our progressive approach and R&D allow us to develop new versions of products to match the latest needs of the industry, embodying our Never say Die??spirit. Position Summary: We are seeking a dynamic and skilled Product Development and Vendor Development Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product development, vendor development, and price negotiation within the automobile aftermarket industry. This role requires a proactive individual who can take up challenges, manage multiple tasks efficiently, and contribute to the growth of our product lines and vendor partnerships. Key Responsibilities: - **Product Development:**   - Lead the design and development of new products from concept to production.   - Collaborate with R&D and engineering teams to ensure product designs meet market requirements.   - Conduct market research to identify emerging trends and customer needs.   - Ensure products comply with industry standards and regulations.   - Develop and manage product roadmaps. - **Vendor Development:**   - Identify and evaluate potential vendors for quality, pricing, and reliability.   - Establish and maintain strong relationships with suppliers.   - Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with vendors to ensure cost-effective procurement.   - Monitor vendor performance and implement improvement plans as needed.   - Source new suppliers to enhance product quality and reduce costs. - **Price Negotiation:**   - Negotiate pricing and terms with suppliers to ensure competitive pricing for products.   - Develop cost-saving strategies and initiatives without compromising on quality.   - Conduct regular market analysis to stay updated with current pricing trends. - **Quality Assurance:**   - Ensure all products meet quality standards and specifications.   - Implement quality control processes and continuous improvement initiatives.   - Conduct supplier audits and inspections to maintain high-quality standards. - **Project Management:**   - Manage product development projects, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to budgets.   - Coordinate with cross-functional teams including engineering, quality assurance, and production.   - Track project progress and report on key milestones and deliverables. - **Supply Chain Management:**   - Oversee supply chain activities to ensure timely availability of materials and components.   - Optimize inventory levels to balance cost and availability.   - Resolve supply chain issues to avoid production disruptions. Key Skills and Qualifications: - Bachelor?? degree in Engineering, Business, or a related field. - Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in product development and vendor management. - Strong negotiation skills with a proven track record in price negotiation. - Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities. - Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies. - Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects simultaneously. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Knowledge of supply chain management and quality assurance practices. - Strong organizational and time management skills.  Benefits: - Competitive salary package (10,000 to 30,000 per month). - Opportunity to work with a leading company in the automobile aftermarket industry. - Professional growth and development opportunities. - Collaborative and supportive work environment. If you are passionate about product development and vendor management, and are looking for an opportunity to grow your career with a dynamic and innovative company, we would love to hear from you.  **To apply, please visit our website:** [https://alterstar.in/](https://alterstar.in/)

column2: Hi Candidate, Job Titles: Sr. and Lead Technical Writer Location: This position is located in Pune & Mumbai.  Please follow the given instructions to apply:  Please copy the given web link, paste it over the URL bar in a new tab, and submit your updated resume.  Once your CV gets shortlisted, you will get an assessment test through RedyHire on your email. https://assessment.redyhire.com/intake/6824175712428454836/048300900090/44d99a02-a0fe-4949-8128-8aa8f6f15b07/5176836939786852979?token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..LLuCTOSYnXmSltqYlJ6uJ1-xkZrFzH2sl_cnlbtNyoo Company Overview:  At Privacera, we are solving deep security and governance challenges across hybrid cloud environments. Enterprises are moving data to the cloud at a rapid pace and enabling multiple cloud services to enable the use of their data. Enabling the right users to have access to the right data is a significant challenge in this cloud-based architecture. Privaceras solution enables a single pane of glass for enterprise visibility of data and enables centralized controls over data in the cloud. Privacera is growing rapidly via the intersection of the two hottest trends in the enterprise industry; enterprise data moving into the public cloud, and the need for security, governance, privacy which are becoming table stakes in every industry. Job Overview: Do you thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic startup environment? Do you like being part of a rapidly growing organization and growing with it? Privacera is a leading provider of software products that Fortune 1000 organizations use to discover, organize, catalog, protect, and govern their cloud and on-premise data assets. At Privacera, you will collaborate with talented colleagues who are passionate about delivering value for enterprise customers. Privacera has the bulk of their operations in India. We are looking for ..  We're looking for a versatile Technical Writer to join the Privacera docs team to create high-quality documentation for Privacera security and governance products and solutions. Your work is going to shape how our customer administrators, app developers, and end users perform activities throughout the deployment lifecycle using the Privacera platform. As a technical writer at Privacera, you'll work in a fast-paced environment, in daily collaboration with development, QA, support, product management, and field personnel. You'll craft customer-facing documentation using a variety of tools that enable you to continuously update content with improvements and new features. To succeed in this role, you are a confident writer of enterprise software documentation who is passionate about learning new concepts and clearly explaining complex software technologies. You are self-motivated, and doggedly pursue the information that your customers need to be successful. You possess a genuine desire to learn new things daily, and to translate complex topics into language thats accessible to end users. You also have a passion for meticulous writing, editing, spelling, grammar, and formatting. We are seeking a skilled and experienced Technical Writing Manager to lead our technical writing team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the creation, maintenance, and dissemination of technical documentation for our products and services. This role involves managing a team of technical writers, ensuring the accuracy, clarity, and consistency of all technical documentation, and collaborating with various departments to gather information and requirements. The Technical Writing Manager will also be responsible for implementing best practices, tools, and processes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the technical writing team. Responsibilities: Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of technical writers. Provide guidance, feedback, and support to ensure the team's success. Foster a collaborative and innovative work environment. Documentation Development: Oversee the creation, editing, and maintenance of technical documentation, including user manuals, installation guides, API documentation, release notes, and other support materials. Ensure that all documentation meets quality standards, including accuracy, clarity, consistency, and adherence to brand guidelines. Collaboration: Collaborate with product managers, engineers, subject matter experts, and other stakeholders to gather information and requirements for documentation projects. Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment between documentation and product development timelines and objectives. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline and improve the documentation process, tools, and workflows. Implement best practices for documentation development, version control, and content management. Stay updated on industry trends and tools related to technical writing and documentation. Quality Assurance: Conduct reviews and audits of documentation to identify and address any errors, inconsistencies, or gaps. Establish and maintain documentation standards and templates. Training and Development: Provide training and professional development opportunities for the technical writing team. Stay informed about emerging technologies and methodologies in technical writing and share knowledge with the team. Requirements 10+ years of experience researching and writing excellent documentation for enterprise software users, infosec admins, governance/compliance personnel, and developers. Experience writing documentation with a strong customer focus. Experience working in an Agile environment. Experience with source control (preferably Git) and structured documentation with an understanding of XML Structured Authoring.  Strong understanding of MSTP or similar style guide. Experience with documentation publishing using SFTP, Amazon S3 or similar. Good understanding of Content reuse with multiple publication management. Strong understanding of DITA or DocBook. Proven understanding of Command Line Interface (CLI) Experience in CCMS (Component Content Management System) Strong with API documentation creation using Postman, Swagger or similar. Portfolio that includes samples showing your ability to write for a technical audience, especially documentation for software running on public cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), containers, and virtual machines.  Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in English, Technical Writing, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. Proven experience (X years) in technical writing, including experience in a leadership or managerial role. Excellent writing, editing, and communication skills, with a keen eye for detail. Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire others. Proficiency in documentation tools and software, such as Microsoft Office, Adobe Technical Communication Suite, MadCap Flare, or similar tools. Experience working in an Agile development environment is a plus. Knowledge of software development processes and technologies. Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment. Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to addressing challenges. Certification in technical writing or project management is desirable. Regards  Rajni  Rajni.lal@privacera.com  HR Executive  8305153604

column2: Eninrac is looking for a research analyst who will be a part of our research & consulting (R&C) team     The candidate will be working for the energy transition industry practice     As a research analyst in the energy transition industry practice, you will be working on strategic, analytical and operational topics likely focusing on many elements surrounding renewable energy & energy transition - Solar, Wind, Green Hydrogen, BESS     The candidate will be required to research and synthesize actionable insights in response to complex research questions posed by our consulting teams and clients, leveraging a solid understanding of business and technology trends, issues and concepts in the conventional & non converntional energy domain           Responsibilities        You will collect and analyze data and information found in primary and secondary research domains.     You will assemble the relevant fact base, counsel consultants and clients on the scope of business operations, technology, and strategic and economic trends within the renewable energy/ energy transition space, and provide insights and analysis for solving our clients problems.     Some of your day-to-day tasks will include to develop & manage Eninracs properietary data tool/(s) in the energy domain, capturing daily insights upon Eninracs properietary platform Einfews relevant to your industry domain.     Developing the data tools shall be a timeline bound job & managing the updates of information/insights/analyses shall be a cyclic practices.     Furthermore, the day-to-day tasks will include working upon Eninracs ecosystem research reports - this will be a cyclic task and releasing updated reports quarterly for the clients shall be the sole responsibility of the candidate.     The ecosystem reports shall include analyses such as benchmarking, trend identification, industry profiling, market sizing, growth projections, opportunity scanning, etc     you'll also provide synthesis, insight and client implications within tight deadlines via end products in the form of PowerPoint charts, written memos, models and frameworks.     You will assisting senior team members with the desired inputs on the industry.     Working as a team player and willing to work in a cross functional team environment when required.     Supporting sales team in preparing the desired pitch for the ecosystem reports/ data tools to the clients. Assisting them in client calls & supporting them with desired sample extracts of the reports.           Requirements & Skills       Bachelors in economics/business administration/engineering with a very good academic record.     Prefered internship or work experince in the renewable energy/new energies domain.     Interested to work in the renewable energy/ new energies industry is a plus.     Superior problem-solving, analytical and quantitative skills.     Capabilities in collection, analysis and synthesis of information and knowledge.     Professional attitude and service orientation.     Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively.     Ability to work independently as we'll as in a team.     Strong multitasking abilities.     Excellent communication skills in English

column2: Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled BSP (Board Support Package) Engineer with specialized experience in HDMI, Audio, or System domains. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in embedded systems, low-level software development, and a deep understanding of hardware-software integration. This role involves designing, developing, and maintaining BSPs for various platforms, ensuring optimal performance and functionality of HDMI and audio interfaces, or other system components. Responsibilitie s: BSP Development and Maintenance: Design, develop, and maintain Board Support Packages (BSP) for embedded platforms. Customize and optimize BSPs to support hardware platforms and ensure compatibility with Linux-based operating systems. Hardware-Software Interface: Interface with hardware components and develop low-level drivers for peripherals, focusing on HDMI and audio frameworks. Kernel and System Programming: Develop and integrate Linux kernel modules and drivers. Perform system programming tasks including memory management and process scheduling. Performance Optimization: Optimize BSPs for performance, power efficiency, and reliability. Implement power management features and system initialization routines. Documentation and Support: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for BSP development and usage. Provide technical support and troubleshooting for BSP-related issues. Collaboration: Work closely with hardware design teams for component selection and system design. Collaborate with software development teams to ensure proper integration of BSPs with application software. Requirements: Education: B.Tech/M.Tech in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, or a related field. Technical Skills: Proficiency in C and C++ programming. Extensive experience with Linux kernel programming and system programming. Strong understanding of HDMI and audio framework integration. Experience with memory management and low-level hardware interfacing. Familiarity with various microcontroller architectures and embedded systems. Tools and Platforms: Experience with development environments and tools such as GCC, GDB, and other cross-compilation tools. Proficiency in version control systems like Git. Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail. Excellent communication and documentation skills.
column11: C, Linux, BSP, C++, Linux Kernel Programming, Memory Management, System Programming, HDMI, Audio, Board Support Package, Linux Kernel, Framework, Linux Device Drivers

Customer Oriented: Quality Control - Oversee control of quality for raw and packaging materials, and drive consistency in product, process, and quality specifications.
